required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluorescence-guided Surgery Using cRGD-ZW800-1 in Oral Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Guided by Light: Optimizing Surgical Excision of Oral Cancer Using Real-time Fluorescence Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two-staged clinical trial to investigate the feasibility of intraoperative Fluorescence Imaging (FLI) to adequately assess tumor margins in patients with oral cancer using cRGD-ZW800-1.

primary_outcome.description: Two dosages of cRGD-ZW800-1 are tested in two groups of each 7 patients. An expansion cohort (n=15) will be added to the dose group that yields the highest TBR.

primary_outcome.measure: WP-II: Rate of adequate (i.e. >5mm clear) tumor resection margins.
primary_outcome.time_frame: through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: WP-II: Sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative predictive values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: WP-II: Co-localization of FLI with immunohistochemistry on pathology slides
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: WP-II: Percentage of extra tissue resection based on FLI-driven frozen sections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op
through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: WP-II: FLI of lymph node metastases after neck dissection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through histopathology, up to max 4 weeks post-op

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Oral Cavity

arm_group.description: n=7. Injection of 0.05 mg/kg cRGD-ZW800-1, within 16-20 hours before imaging/surgery
n=7. Injection of (to be determined) mg/kg RGD-ZW800-1, within (to be determined) hours before imaging/surgery.

n=15: expansion cohort (n=15) will be added to the group of patients that had received the selected dose in WP-I. Injection of 0.05 ór (to be determined) mg/kg cRGD-ZW800-1, within 48 hours before imaging/surgery.

intervention.description: Injection of cRGD-ZW800-1 within 48 hours before imaging/surgery

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
